verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
atha tatrāgamad brahmā
bhavānyā ca samaṁ bhavaḥ
mahendra-pramukhā devā
munayaḥ sa-prajeśvarāḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; atha—then; tatra—there; āgamat—came; brahmā—Lord Brahmā; bhavānyā—his consort, Bhavānī; ca—and; samam—along with; bhavaḥ—Lord Śiva; mahā-indra-pramukhāḥ—led by Lord Indra; devāḥ—the demigods; munayaḥ—the sages; sa—with; prajā-īśvarāḥ—the progenitors of the universe's population.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Then Lord Brahmā arrived at Prabhāsa along with Lord Śiva and his consort, the sages, the Prajāpatis and all the demigods, headed by Indra.
